Text: The #GOPTaxScam triggers an automatic $25 billion Medicare cut. Speaker Ryan's plan is to trade severe Medicare cuts for massive giveaways to the wealthiest individuals and corporations.

In short, the #GOPTaxScam give huge breaks to those who don’t need it, at the expense of those who desperately need it. We deserve a better deal - one that brings more jobs to America and higher wages to American workers. I opposed today's tax bill because it does the opposite.

The #GOPTaxScam would raise taxes on 992,000 Florida households next year in order to give tax breaks to the wealthiest individuals and corporations. And it would explode the deficit in the process.

I urge my colleagues to join me in voting against this bill today.

618,450 Floridians claimed the student loan interest deduction in 2015 with an average deduction of $1,039. 

But the #GOPTaxScam eliminates this deduction, too.

Over 2 million households in Florida deduct state and local taxes, with average deduction of $7,300. 

But the #GOPTaxScam eliminates this deduction.

From @SoFlaOpinion: "President Trump called the House Republican tax plan 'a big beautiful Christmas present' for the American people. Not unless most of them — especially many Floridians — want coal in their stockings."

"Americans have a right to live their lives from of the fear of gun violence. We can bring commonsense solutions to act on this epidemic."
"High capacity magazines aren't tools for self defense or sport. They're designed to cause damage - at schools, a theatre, and a concert."
.@Bradybuzz: "We know that if the American people come together to demand it, we can affect change. And that's what they're doing now."
.@Pride_Fund: "As an Iraq war eveteran, I fully believe high capacity magazines have no place on our streets. Americans must demand action."
.@CSGV: "The evidence shows that banning high-capacity magazine worked. Congress allowed the ban to expire. We can't accept this as normal."
.@moveon: "This legislation has teeth to it, and it's a battle we can win. The people of America are demanding action."
.@CAPActionGuns: "We can reduce the lethality of gun violence. Elected officials must stand against the NRA to protect Americans."
There's no singular remedy to end gun violence. But that doesn't mean we can't act. The Keep Americans Safe Act will make meaningful impact.
To my colleagues, I say: the time to act is today, tomorrow, and every day until Congress passes meaningful gun violence legislation.
If we did what voters sent us to do, we would have passed gun violence bills already. The American people have suffered too much already.
The new House routine seems to be send thoughts & prayers, stand for a moment of silence, and then claim we can do nothing to end violence.
"There's no reason to have high capacity magazines. It was wrong for this ban to lapse, and it's time for us to right that wrong."
.@RepJackyRosen: "It's urgent that we take meaningful action in passing gun safety measures. Thoughts and prayers are not enough."
.@RepKihuen: "It is time for my colleagues to stop taking marching orders from the NRA" and take up #KeepAmericansSafeAct.
.@RepKihuen: "It's unacceptable that after 58 innocent victims lost their lives, we refuse to talk about common sense legislation."
